Checkbox

Use the checkbox component to allow the user to select one or more options in a list. Use the checkbox in forms.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-checkbox

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-checkbox

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-checkbox/src/scss/checkbox";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Checkbox

Standard checkbox

      <label class="vl-checkbox" for="checkbox-1">
    <input class="vl-checkbox__toggle" type="checkbox" id="checkbox-1" name="checkbox-1" value="1"/>
    <div class="vl-checkbox__label">
      <i class="vl-checkbox__box" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Optie 1
      </div>
  </label>

Checkbox block

Use the .vl-checkbox--block modifier to create a block element for the checkbox. The checkbox width will be equal to its parent element.

      <label class="vl-checkbox vl-checkbox--block" for="checkbox-2">
    <input class="vl-checkbox__toggle" type="checkbox" id="checkbox-2" name="checkbox-2" value="1"/>
    <div class="vl-checkbox__label">
      <i class="vl-checkbox__box" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Optie 2
      </div>
  </label>

Checkbox error

Use the .vl-checkbox--error modifier to make the checkbox selection mandatory. You can combine this variant with a corresponding error message.

      <label class="vl-checkbox vl-checkbox--error" for="checkbox-3">
    <input class="vl-checkbox__toggle" type="checkbox" id="checkbox-3" name="checkbox-3" value="1"/>
    <div class="vl-checkbox__label">
      <i class="vl-checkbox__box" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Optie 3
      </div>
  </label>

Checkbox disabled

Use the [disabled] attribute to prevent a user from selecting the checkbox.

      <label class="vl-checkbox vl-checkbox--disabled" for="checkbox-4">
    <input class="vl-checkbox__toggle" type="checkbox" id="checkbox-4" name="checkbox-4" value="1" disabled/>
    <div class="vl-checkbox__label">
      <i class="vl-checkbox__box" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Optie 4
      </div>
  </label>

Checkbox single

Use the .vl-checkbox--single modifier to hide the connected checkbox label.

      <label class="vl-checkbox vl-checkbox--single" for="checkbox-5">
    <input class="vl-checkbox__toggle" type="checkbox" id="checkbox-5" name="checkbox-5" value="1"/>
    <div class="vl-checkbox__label">
      <i class="vl-checkbox__box" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        <span class="vl-u-visually-hidden">Optie 5</span>
      </div>
  </label>

Switch

Checkbox variant displayed as a switch

      <div class="vl-checkbox--switch__wrapper">
    <input class="vl-checkbox--switch" type="checkbox" id="checkbox-6" name="checkbox-6" value="1"/>
    <label class="vl-checkbox--switch__label" for="checkbox-6">
        <span aria-hidden="true"></span>
        <span class="vl-u-visually-hidden">Instellingen blokkeren</span>
    </label>
  </div>

Switch disabled

Disabled checkbox variant displayed as a switch

      <div class="vl-checkbox--switch__wrapper">
    <input class="vl-checkbox--switch" type="checkbox" id="checkbox-7" name="checkbox-7" value="1" disabled/>
    <label class="vl-checkbox--switch__label" for="checkbox-7">
        <span aria-hidden="true"></span>
        <span class="vl-u-visually-hidden">Instellingen blokkeren</span>
    </label>
  </div>

Accessibility

Always pair the checkbox error variant with text. Never rely on color alone to indicate an error during form validation.
